summary.body: I just spotted on Frank Harris' website that prices for Barbican flats are up. So does this reflect a real increase, with the Barbican bucking the trend for the rest of London, or is that estate agent overvaluing?
summary.subject: property prices

summary.body: I'm currently looking for a one bedroom flat in the Barbican, preferably over two floors. I'm finding it difficult going round all the different estate agents, and I was wondering if there was a central point where all vacant flats were advertised?
summary.subject: Estate Agents

summary.body: I am thinking about selling my flat (type 20, Defoe House, near the lake) but have never sold anything before and don't want to be taken to the cleaners. What is the normal estate agent fee, is VAT added and does anyone have hints on local agents please? I understand that Frank Harrris and Hamilton Brooks are the most poplar. Is it normal to negotiate the fee? All rather worrying.  Thank you for your help.
summary.subject: Estate Agents

summary.body: We have a type 21 in the middle of Defoe and are getting ready to rent it out for a year because we are cycling to India from London for charity. I'm thinking of using Frank Harris as managing agent but was wondering if anybody had good/bad experience with any other agents. This is the first time I will have rented out the flat so any advice would be much appreciated.
summary.subject: renting out a flat- any advice

summary.body: My partner just sold his flat (not a Barbican one but one down the road) through Currell and I've been so impressed with them I wanted to pass it on. I haven't got any connection with them aside from that they sold the flat, but appreciate you only have my word for it. We used an other agent at first (best not name them for fear of libel but it's a big company) and I was appalled at the service they offered, booking viewings in with people that didn't turn up (and the agent didn't turn up) shouting at me down the phone if I couldn't do a viewing with one hour's notice, that sort of thing. As I had to do most of the day to day stuff I found it hideously stressful. Anyway, eventually we changed and we've been really pleased and I thought others might find this nugget of information helpful..or not.
summary.subject: A positive experience of estate agents
